title: Tab placement & behavior Firefox 90
content: Help! In Firefox 89 (as in all previous) all open tabs lined up at the top (first screen shot). When I updated to 90, they disappeared and only one (current) tab shows up at bottom right (second screen shot). I cannot find a way to see all open tabs as before - only when I close the current tab will the entire lineup of open tabs show for a moment and then go back to the single current open tab. I can't work this way and it's driving me crazy. I've searched online, tried changing settings in about:config and nothing seems to want to put all open tabs back up top where they were. What am I missing? (More - I am trying to upload a screen shot and just get the spinning gear. The file is below the upload size limit. I'm going to try submitting this anyway.)
creator: rpini

title: specific facebook video not playing on firefox but plays on other browser
content:
Hi, I have uploaded a video to facebook and the video is not playing, after clicking the video it goes black and only the loading icon visible until it says "Sorry, we're having trouble playing this video." I tried to play it from another web browser and it works fine no issues. note that other facebook and youtube videos play fine on firefox, things I've tried deleting browsing history, didn't work restarted firefox with add-ons disabled, didn't work created a new profile, didn't work

didn't reinstall and not going to, I really don't care since other videos play fine and my video is fine and others can watch it but it's driving me crazy, I just want to know why my video isn't playing!
creator: shortfuse.9112

title: Visualizzazione invertita font Time New Roman nei siti web
content: Da qualche giorno ho un problema con la visualizzazione del font Times New Roman normale nei testi dei siti web. In pratica i caratteri appaiono speculari. Questo è successo dopo che ho installato un font di mia creazione che avevo chiamato Times New Roman Mirror che mi serve, abbastanza raramente, per riprodurre delle scritte speculari. Ovviamente ho disinstallato il font in questione ma il problema permane solo con Firefox mentre su Chrome tutto funziona correttamente come peraltro in tutte le altre applicazioni come Word, Excel ecc. Prima di procedere con una nuova installazione di Firefox, che essendo il mio browser preferito, ha ormai al suo interno moltissimi dati personali memorizzati, con la perdita dei dati stessi, volevo chiedere se qualcuno ha suggerimenti per risolvere il problema. Tra l'altro non sono nemmeno sicuro che una nuova installazione risolverebbe il problema. Premetto che ho provato a sostituire il font predefinito nelle preferenze ma non ho ottenuto alcun risultato e qualsiasi font metta Firefox mantiene sempre il TNR. Da notare che l'anomalia si presenta solo con il TNR normale mentre invece (come si può notare nell' immagine allegata) il Grassetto sembra non avere problemi. Ho provato a creare nuovi profili sulla base di vecchi dati salvati in precedenza ma nulla è cambiato. La prova finale è stata quella di cercare anche con about:config ma ho lasciato tutto inalterato dato che non saprei nemmeno come o cosa cercare. Un ringraziamento anticipato per qualsiasi suggerimento.
creator: freddy.furlan

Saludos

title: (ne)zobrazování loga
content: Ahoj odborníci, mám webové stránky u Webnode a vlevo nahoře je možnost zobrazení loga s textem. Text EMINES se mi zobrazuje ve všech prohlížečích, ale logo vlevo před textem ne jen v Mozille, symbol zeměkoule (mám ještě Vivaldi, Operu, Chrom a Edge a tam je vše OK). Prohledal jsem všechna nastavení ve Firefoxu a nenašel nic, co by to mohlo způsobovat, admini z Webnode na tom pracují, ale už delší dobu bez výsledku (nebo na to kašlou). Nejde sice o život, ale o funkci, mám rád, když vše funguje jak má. Pokud někdo umíte poradit, mrkněte na https://emines.webnode.cz/ vlevo nahoře (na všech podstránkách taky) a díky předem za funkční radu. Jsem bývalý ajťák, sice ne programátor, takže prosím seriozně  :-) Hezký den - Emi
creator: emines

title: FF frequently loses my open tabs
content:
Windows 7x64 desktop PC, FF 90.0(64), Startup set to 'restore previous session'.

When researching subjects I can often run with 60 - 80 tabs open. Frequently, if I take time out to do some other pressing task (in response to email etc.) and that task opens a new window, sometimes closing my main window without my knowledge, this appears to cause a problem for FF in that if the new window is closed after I've finished the task and now find that my main window has already been closed, the restore tabs procedure restores the last session tabs and appears to have dumped my main session tabs. As you will readily understand, this makes it a long drawn out problem trying to restore my working point from history when I can't remember exactly which tabs were still open or which page I had landed on. I do hope you follow all that. My question is how can I prevent this from messing me up again in future? Is there a way to retain session details so I can select them again after other windows have been opened and closed? Can you please avoid techie answers cos' they'll be over my head ;-), Thanks in advance.
creator: Vicr

title: Need help in checking the dom node position for different screen resoultions
content:
Hi,

We are working on an Open Source Chrome extension: Digital Assistant Client

I am recording the domnode by converting into json by domJson and saving into server. We can find the same recordednode by comparing the json attributes and matching to the original node on the page. We have one problem here when we search for the nodes sometimes we get similar nodes via json which has same property names. In that case we are trying to match the node position that we have recorded. When we try to match the node position in different screen resolutions, it gives us the wrong node. How do we solve this. My code is as given below

// calculate distance between selected node and matching node getDistance: function (node1, node2) { 

  const x = node1.x - node2.x;   const y = node1.y - node2.y;   const dist = Math.abs(Math.sqrt(Math.pow(x, 2) + Math.pow(y, 2)));   return dist;

},
creator: yureshwar

title: How to find page/dom load completed
content:
Hi,

We are working on an Open Source Chrome extension: Digital Assistant Client

We have a script which invokes clicks on web pages. We record a sequence of clicks as a 'flow' or 'task'. i.e. After the first click is invoked, we wait 5 s for the page to load and then invoke the 2nd click.

setTimeout(function(){UDAPluginSDK.showhtml();}, 5000);

Now, instead of waiting for 5s, we want to explore if we can invoke the 2nd click as soon as the page is loaded. We tried using "onPageLoad" but we realised that this does not work for modern single page (responsive) applications. i.e. we don't know when the js has finished executing.

window.addEventListener('load', (event) => { 

  setTimeout(function (){      UDAPluginSDK.modifybodyhtml();   },2000);

});
creator: yureshwar

title: Clicking other shortcuts reload current page IF current page is still loading
content: If I open a page and immediately click one of my Bookmark Bar shortcuts to a different page, the current page reloads instead. Some pages take a second or longer to load, and I don't want to wait to click a different shortcut. I can also click the X to stop the current page loading and then other shortcuts work fine. It's when the current page is still loading which ANY other bookmark is clicked that Firefox merely reloads the page that I'm already on. This is really annoying. It will do it continuously if I keep clicking on any shortcut when the page loads. The same page, the original page. Forever.
creator: fidothree

title: firefox using high cpu and memory as of the day of posting.
content:
Just today, firefox began slowing down and soft crashing for minutes at a time. During this time, I can interact with websites, but it doesn't change the visuals or show that anything has changed. new tabs open but don't show up, youtube video audio plays but the screen remains fixed. Firefox usage for just 7 tabs is well over 5 gigatybes of ram and 10-20% cpu at all times.

I attempted everything on the help page, including: killing and restarting firefox, updating firefox, updating windows, restarting my computer, killing firefox and rebooting again, disabling extensions, and updating graphics drivers.

after rebooting with the new windows update, firefox ran smoothly for a brief minute and showed normal cpu/ram usage, but quickly climbed back up to pre reboot numbers.
creator: ametueraspirant
